div.p: NARRATOR: Psychological dependence characterizes the Orange Phase. The elements of psychological dependence are integration and preoccupation, state dependent learning, sense of relationship, and defenses.

NARRATOR: People in the Orange Phase also experience everything that's in the Yellow Phase. They continue to make high-risk choices that exceed the 0-1-2-3 guidelines, and their high-risk choices become more frequent.
NARRATOR: They can have a significant increase in their tolerance. And they're even more likely to experience health or impairment problems.
NARRATOR: Social dependence in the Orange Phase can make their problems seem normal, and intensify their psychological dependence.
NARRATOR: In addition to psychological dependence, people in the Orange Phase may also have problems similar to alcoholism, like memory blackouts and drinking to cure hangovers.
